TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TcpConnectionPoolSettings extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents properties that control the behavior of the TCP connection pool.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ GroupName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.GroupName : string with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the group name of the connection pool group on the client.
Docs.value: The group name of the connection pool group on the client. The default name is "default".

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value can be changed to isolate the connections for a particular client into separate groups.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan IdleTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.IdleTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum time the connection can be idle in the connection pool before being disconnected.
Docs.value: Returns a structure that indicates the maximum time the connection can be idle in the connection pool before being disconnected.
Docs.exception: The value is less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan LeaseTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.LeaseTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time span after which a connection in the connection pool is closed.
Docs.value: Returns a structure that indicates the time span after which a cached TCP connection is purged from the connection pool.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property bounds the overall lifetime of a socket. Once a socket has been around longer than <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpConnectionPoolSettings.LeaseTimeout%2A>, it is closed as soon as it is returned to the connection pool. The connection cache used by the TCP transport creates new connections as required for each endpoint up to the cache limit that is set by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpConnectionPoolSettings.MaxOutboundConnectionsPerEndpoint%2A>.

Docs.exception: The value cannot be less than zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaxOutboundConnectionsPerEndpoint { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaxOutboundConnectionsPerEndpoint : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of outbound connections for each endpoint that is cached in the connection pool.
Docs.value: The maximum number of allowed outbound connections for each endpoint that is cached in the connection pool. The default value is 10.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This limits the number of connections that are cached for each unique remote endpoint. If this value is exceeded by having more active client connections, then the service may appear unresponsive to the client and this value should be adjusted to exceed the maximum number of expected connections that are cached for each unique remote endpoint.
This setting can also be set on the service side, in which case the value is used to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MaxPooledConnections%2A> on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpChannelListener>.

Docs.exception: The value is less than or equal to zero.
